title: Presidential Power Gets Tested Before Supreme Court After Long Conservative Project to Shrink Agencies
summary: President Trump has repeatedly ousted leaders of independent agencies despite federal laws meant to shield those regulators from politics.

title: For Landmark Test of Executive Power, Echoes of a 1930s Supreme Court Battle
summary: Franklin D. Roosevelt’s efforts to oust a Federal Trade Commission leader offer parallels to the current fight over President Trump’s actions.

title: Superpower Competition: The Missing Chapter in Trump’s Security Strategy
summary: President Trump is shifting from discussion of the long-lasting competition among the world’s biggest economies and nuclear powers.

title: Judge Stalls Justice Dept. Effort to Seek New Comey Indictment
summary: The judge’s decision prevented the government until at least next Friday from having access to much of the evidence it used to secure its original indictment against Mr. Comey.

title: This Nebraska Prison Rehabilitated Inmates. Until ICE Paid to Fill It With Immigrants.
summary: Over two decades, a minimum-security prison aimed at helping inmates prepare to leave prison was a point of civic pride. Now, state officials have converted it to ICE detention.

title: How Stablecoins Can Help Criminals Launder Money and Evade Sanctions
summary: Through layers of intermediaries, stablecoins can be moved, swapped and mixed into pools of other funds in ways that are difficult to trace, experts say.

title: How Biden Ignored Warnings and Lost Americans’ Faith in Immigration
summary: The Democratic president and his top advisers rejected recommendations that could have eased the border crisis that helped return Donald Trump to the White House.

title: 4 Takeaways From The Times’s Reporting on Biden’s Immigration Record
summary: A New York Times review of President Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s actions on immigration showed that they created an opening for a more aggressive Trump administration agenda.

title: A Small Illinois City at the Center of a Seismic Shift in Abortion Access
summary: Carbondale, Ill., a liberal enclave within driving distance of 10 states with abortion bans, has become a hub for the procedure. Last year there were nearly 11,000 abortions in this city of 21,000.

title: The Married Scientists Torn Apart by a Covid Bioweapon Theory
summary: In 2020, a Chinese virologist fled to the United States, aided by allies of President Trump who sought to promote her unproven theories about the origins of Covid-19. Her husband still can’t find her.

title: What Do Republicans Have to Fear? Ask Tennessee.
summary: What a special House election just told us.

title: The Crucial Lesson of a Forgotten Nixon-Era Episode
summary: After my father-in-law died, we found something interesting in his files.

title: Your Gift Dilemmas, Solved
summary: An expert from Wirecutter helps Morning readers with their trickiest holiday gift searches.

title: Hong Kong Holds Vote as Officials Move Against ‘Anti-China’ Elements
summary: The government is pushing hard to raise turnout in an election overshadowed by a deadly fire and public anger over safety lapses and official accountability.

title: Benin Coup Attempt to Oust Talon Has Been Foiled, Interior Minister Says
summary: The country’s interior minister said the situation was under control after a “small group of soldiers launched a mutiny,” but the president had yet to make a public statement.

title: In Brazil’s Answer to Hollywood, Dreams and Drought Share the Stage
summary: A dusty town in the parched northeast has become the nation’s show business destination. But climate change and technology are posing new challenges there.
